page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: Most households in the village have a car. Only 2 out of our sample of 32 did not have their own motor vehicle. However a lot of people rely on the bus where there is only 1 car in the family but 2 or more people needing to travel, so everyone in our survey was against cutting public transport even if they did not use it themselves. The Hull to Barnsley railway passed through our sector, and there is still the long tunnel which had to be cut through the chalk hills by navvies. The line was uneconomic and closed in 1956.
